newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot resid prices steady on firm paper values.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot resid prices steady on firm paper values.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel oil prices ended steady to higher Wednesday, supported by firmness in the paper market, brokers and traders said.
The forwards and physical resid values, which were at parity, held their gains from Tuesday despite weaker crude and natural prices, industry sources said.

NYMEX October crude futures finished down 16 cents at $23.24 a barrel after surging more than a dollar Tuesday due to escalating tension between U.S. and Iraq, which resulted a number of attacks on Iraqi military installation since this past weekend.
Meanwhile, NYMEX October Henry Hub natural gas futures settled down 5.7 cents at $1.764 per million British thermal units on softer cash prices.
In the New York harbor, September one percent sulphur paper prices closed at $17.40-$17.60 a barrel, compared with $17.25-$17.55 earlier today.
In the Gulf Coast paper market, October three percent values finished at $15.50-$15.75 with several confirmed trades reported at $15.50. compared with $15.40-$15.60 earlier today.
No physical trade was heard reported.
"There's little interest from end-users," said one trader.
New York city gate September gas prices were assessed at $2.05 today, versus NYH one percent resid at a $2.77/mmBtu equivalent.
Separately, a number of resid players were absent from the market because of an industry event in Connecticut.
